abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is unsatisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. This project confirms lessons from previous
            similar experience, regarding: 1) reaching agreement with
            beneficiaries on a consistent cost and fees setting
            mechanism to ensure the economic viability of social
            infrastructures; 2) to ensure ability to pay services and
            fees among villagers, the promotion of income generating
            activities, that would create growth and increase household
            (thus, as a consequence community) financial resources, has
            to accompany the provision of social infrastructures; 3)
            training should be delivered in a more professional manner
            by mobilizing training institutes and using training
            modules; 4) communities have to be the main actors--through
            a learning-by-doing process, accompanied by sound training
            programs, and close follow-up by partners; and 5) the
            preparation nearly took three years but was a key element of
            success through: identification of targeted villages,
            piloting of intervention modalities, assessment of NGOs
            capacity and elaboration of a training action plan,
            preparation of community capacity building programs (tools,
            content and implementation modalities). New lessons were
            learned as well regarding the provision of management
            advisory services, decentralization, confidence building
            among stakeholders, social capital and capacity building
            activities; and monitoring and evaluation.
